strName.description: The code name of this interaction, as referred to in the data.

strTitle.description: The name of this interaction as shown to players in UI and context menus.

strDesc.description: Long description of this interaction that usually displays in the log. Often include [us], [them], and [3rd] variables.

strTargetPoint.description: Name of the interaction point to use on target when interacting (assigned in condowners.json). null = anywhere on map is fine. (E.g. waiting)

fTargetPointRange.description: Max radius around target point in which this interaction can happen (n tiles)

strAnim.description: Name of the animation to play when interacting. Animation options are hard-coded (E.g. Use, Tooling, Tablet, Talk, Sitting, Yes, No)

strIdleAnim.description: Sets the current idle animation (what runs after this interaction ends)

strBubble.description: Name of the bubble image to show above the character while the interaction is ocurring.

strMapIcon.description: Name of the map icon image to show (usually over the target) when assigned as a task. E.g. construction sign.

strColor.description: Name of the color to use in logged messages (E.g. Good, Goodish, Neutral, Badish, Bad)

strDuty.description: Optional duty this interaction falls under. if non-null, context choosing this action will add it to task list. null will do action directly.

strThemType.description: Does this apply to self, room, direction, or others? (Usually Other)

strRaiseUI.description: The name of the UI key in CO's mapGUIPropMaps this interaction pulls up.

strLedgerDef.description: The name of the ledgerdef to execute with this interaction (I.e. how this interaction impacts player finances directly).

strCancelInteraction.description: Optional interaction to append when AICancelCurrent is used to prematurely end this interaction.

strUseCase.description: if this interaction has aLootItms with "use", this is the use case they should apply. (strName from chargeprofiles.json).

fDuration.description: Duration of this interaction in hours.

strTeleport.description: Name of point we should teleport to when performing this interaction (usually set in the target's condowners.json entry).

aInverse.description: List of IDs of inverse interactions this causes in granter (or next interaction in a chain). e.g. "chat" has inverse of "chat reply" or "snap reply". Including ",[us],[them]" at the end of an interaction name retains the same actor/target roles, otherwise [us] and [them] flip.

LootCTsUs.description: Loot of condition trigger IDs this applies to petitioner/[us] now.

LootCTsThem.description: Loot of condition trigger IDs this applies to granter/[them] now.

LootCTs3rd.description: Loot of condition trigger IDs this applies to 3rd party/[3rd] now.

LootCondsUs.description: Loot of conditions this applies to petitioner/[us] now.

LootCondsThem.description: Loot of conditions this applies to granter/[them] now.

LootConds3rd.description: Loot of conditions this applies to 3rd party/[3rd] now.

CTTestUs.description: Name of condition trigger (in condtrigs.json) assigning conditions that are required/forbidden on [us] to trigger/allow this interaction.

CTTestThem.description: Name of condition trigger (in condtrigs.json) assigning conditions that are required/forbidden on [them] to trigger/allow this interaction.

CTTest3rd.description: Name of condition trigger (in condtrigs.json) assigning conditions that are required/forbidden on [3rd] to trigger/allow this interaction.

PSpecTestThem.description: Optional JsonPersonSpec defining a valid them.

strLootItmAddUs.description: Loot items to add to [us] when this interaction happens, defined as item type entry loot names found in loot.json or loot_self_reference.json

strLootItmAddThem.description: Loot items to add to [them] when this interaction happens, defined as item type entry in loot.json or loot_self_reference.json

strLootCTsRemoveUs.description: Loot to remove from [us] when this interaction happens, defined as CT/trigger type entry in loot.json or loot_self_reference.json

strLootItmRemoveThem.description: Loot items to add to [them] when this interaction happens, defined as item type entry in loot.json or loot_self_reference.json

strLootCTsGive.description: Loot [us] gives [them] when this interaction happens, defined as CT/trigger type entry in loot.json or loot_self_reference.json

strLootCTsUse.description: Loot [us] uses when this interaction happens, defined as CT/trigger type entry in loot.json or loot_self_reference.json

strLootCTsTake.description: Loot [them] gives [us] when this interaction happens, defined as CT/trigger type entry in loot.json or loot_self_reference.json

strLootCTsLacks.description: Loot [us] must lack when this interaction happens, defined as CT/trigger type entry in loot.json or loot_self_reference.json

strLootItmInputs.description: Loot [them] requires in their Lot before this interaction happens, defined as item type entry in loot.json or loot_self_reference.json

strCTThemMultCondUs.description: Name of condition on objUs that multiplies LootCTsThem output, defined as condition type entry in loot.json or loot_self_reference.json

strCTThemMultCondTools.description: name of condition on aLootItms "use" tools that multiplies LootCTsThem output, defined as condition type entry in loot.json or loot_self_reference.json

objLootModeSwitch.description: Loot definition [us] will become after this interaction, defined as item type entry in loot.json or other loot.json (make sure a person does not modeswitch).

objLootModeSwitchThem.description: Loot definition [them] will become after this interaction, defined as item type entry in loot.json or other loot.json (make sure a person does not modeswitch).

bTargetOwned.description: If true, target must be on ship [us] owns.

bEquip.description: If true, items gained in interaction will attempt to equip into a valid slot.

bLot.description: If true, items gained in interaction will go into them's aLot list, for crafting/modeswitching.

bPassThrough.description: If true, this interaction will attempt to pass through to objects inside container, if applicable.

strStartInstall.description: If not null, this interaction triggers the placeholder installation process from context menu, using a CO of type strStartInstall.

strPledgeAdd.description: The name of the pledges.json entry this interaction will attempt to add to [us] when this interaction executes.

aTickersUs.description: List of ticker name strings to add or remove to [us] when this interaction executes. "-" prefix means remove.

aTickersThem.description: List of ticker name strings to add or remove to [them] when this interaction executes. "-" prefix means remove.

nLogging.description: Determines who sees this interaction in their log: 0 = nobody, 1 = interaction participants, 2 = everyone in this room, 3 = everyone on this ship.

pledge.description: The pledge from pledges.json related to this interaction, if any; null if none.

nMoveType.description: the type of move this is (usually default is 0, but social moves can be special types).

strLootRELChangeUs.description: relationship changes to apply to [us] when this interaction executes.

strLootRELChangeThem.description: relationship changes to apply to [them] when this interaction executes.

bPause.description: Should time and fast-forward be paused when this interaction occurs?

bSocial.description: If true, this is a social move, and will be used for AI training.

bIgnoreFeelings.description: If true, and multiple aInverse options trigger, choose first valid option (i.e. order matters). If false, AI chooses what it wants from valid options based on mood and history.

bRandomInverse.description: If true, and multiple aInverse options trigger equally, choose one at random. otherwise, choose first valid option (i.e. order matters).

bOpener.description: If true, CO can open with this interaction; if false, it can only be used in a reply.

bGambit.description: If true, this move is a gambit and can trigger special events/responses, meant for social combat.

bCloser.description: If true, this will end social combat and sub UIs.

bGetItemBefore.description: If true, this will end social combat and sub UIs.

bDestroyItem.description: If true, [us] will destroy items after they are removed. false drops on ground.

bHumanOnly.description: If true, only human players can initiate this interaction, not NPCs (e.g. UI-based interactions).

bGiveWholeStack.description: If true, Give commands will operate on whole stack when removing COs.

bRemoveWholeStack.description: If true, Remove commands will operate on whole stack when removing COs.

bModeSwitchCheckFit.description: If true, modwswitch output COs will attempt to fit tiles via rules; false will ignore rules and use same position.

bNoWait.description: If true, them will not wait for us when this starts.

bVerboseTrigger.description: If true, will add log messages about why this didn't trigger.

bHardCode.description: If true, this interaction ties into hard-coded functionality in C#/Unity code.

aLootItms.description: List of commands related to how this interaction adds, removes, or moves items among participants. Valid options are addus (item), addthem (item), removeus (CT+), removethem (item), take (CT), give (CT), use (CT), lacks (CT), input (item). All these must be followed by a strName (usually a CT or item in loot.json), and sometimes 1 or 3 boolean parameters.
aLootItms.details: addus,strName[loot item]; use,strName[loot CT/trigger], [bGetItemBefore]; lacks,strName[loot CT/trigger], [bGetItemBefore]; input,strName[loot item], [bGetItemBefore]; give,strName[loot CT/trigger],[bGetItemBefore],[bGiveWholeStack]; RemoveUs,strName[loot CT/trigger],[bGetItemBefore],[bDestroyItem],[bRemoveWholeStack];
